item.title: 「中英」中國在西太平洋大規模軍演，反擊美國施壓
item.content:encoded:
The News

新聞

China launched large-scale military drills in the Western Pacific this week, deploying an aircraft carrier and dozens of naval ships and warplanes in a major show of force aimed at pushing back at U.S. pressure.

本週，中國在西太平洋展開大規模軍事演習，部署了一艘航空母艦、數十艘海軍艦艇和戰機來彰顯武力，反擊美國的施壓。

The joint exercises come after the United States conducted a series of military drills across the region in recent weeks with allies like Japan, Australia and the Philippines. On Saturday, the American and Canadian navies sailed ships through the Taiwan Strait.

在本輪聯合演習之前，美國近幾週才與日本、澳洲和菲律賓等盟國在該地區舉行了一系列軍演。週六，美國和加拿大的海軍艦隊駛過台灣海峽。

What We Know

已知情況

China’s Shandong aircraft carrier was one of at least 20 Chinese naval vessels spotted navigating waters around Japan, Taiwan and the Philippines starting on Tuesday, according to the Japanese and Taiwanese governments.

據日本和台灣政府稱，從週二開始，至少有20艘中國海軍艦艇被發現在日本、台灣和菲律賓附近海域航行，中國「山東號」航母也在其中。

Other vessels identified by Japanese officials included missile destroyers, frigates and supply ships.

日本官員確認的其它船艦包括導彈驅逐艦、護衛艦和補給艦。

China also sent at least 68 warplanes near Taiwanese airspace on Thursday, up from 35 on Wednesday, Taiwan’s Ministry of National Defense said. Some of those aircraft joined the naval exercises. Planes were spotted taking off and landing on the Shandong, according to Japan’s Ministry of Defense.

台灣國防部表示，中國週四派遣了至少68架戰機飛近台灣領空，比週三的35架更多。其中一些飛機參加了海軍演習。日本防衛省表示，已發現有飛機在「山東號」上起降。

China has not announced any exercises involving the Shandong, its first domestically built aircraft carrier, one of two carriers China has in service.

中國尚未公布「山東號」參與任何演習的情況。「山東號」是中國第一艘國產航母，也是中國現役的兩艘航母之一。

What the Analysts Say

專家觀點

The drills appeared to be focusing on some of the People’s Liberation Army’s deficiencies: the ability to keep up operations far from its shores and coordinate between different forces on the water and in the air.

演習的重點似乎是彌補人民解放軍的一些短板：在遠離海岸的地方持續作戰的能力，以及水上和空中不同部隊之間的協作。

“It looks to me like they were practicing sustained air operations toward the West Pacific in conjunction with their carrier exercises, something we haven’t seen at this scale before,” said Ben Lewis, an independent defense analyst based in Washington, who tracks Chinese military activity around Taiwan.

「在我看來，他們是在結合航母演習，對西太平洋持續空中作戰的能力進行演練，這種演習規模是前所未見的，」華盛頓的獨立防務問題專家本·劉易斯表示，他一直在追蹤中國在台灣周邊的軍事活動。

Mr. Lewis said China’s military was likely practicing enforcing a blockade around Taiwan, the self-governed island that Beijing claims and has threatened to take by force. A blockade would complicate the United States’ ability to come to Taiwan’s aid if it were to be invaded by China.

劉易斯表示，中國軍隊可能在演練對台灣周邊海域實施封鎖。北京宣稱擁有該自治島嶼的主權，並威脅要以武力奪取該島。如果台灣被中國入侵，封鎖將給美國對台援助帶來更多麻煩。

“China wants to use this exercise to showcase that it has the ability to fly over the first island chain,” said Lin Ying-yu, an assistant professor at Tamkang University in Taipei, referring to the string of major archipelagos — Japan, Taiwan and the Philippines — nearest to China’s coast.

「中國希望通過這次演習來證明其有能力飛越第一島鏈，」台北淡江大學助理教授林穎佑表示，第一島鏈指的是距離中國海岸最近的一系列主要群島，即日本、台灣和菲律賓。

“By sending out big numbers of its jets and vessels, it wants to let the other players in the region know that it possesses the ability to launch joint attacks by sea and air forces,” he added.

「通過派遣大量戰機和軍艦，中國希望讓該地區的其他勢力明白，它有能力發動海空聯合攻擊，」他還說。

Background

背景

China has deployed more planes and ships to challenge American dominance in the region. At the same time, it has grown more frustrated with the United States’ efforts to strengthen security alliances with Asian allies.

中國增加了戰機和船艦的部署，以挑戰美國在該地區的主導地位。與此同時，中國也對美國加強與亞洲盟友安全聯盟的努力愈發不滿。

Last month, the United States signed a trilateral agreement with Japan and South Korea aimed at deterring Chinese aggression in places like Taiwan. Beijing has accused Washington of launching another Cold War by trying to contain China’s rightful rise.

上個月，美國與日本韓國簽署了一項三邊協議，旨在遏制中國對台灣等地區的侵犯。中國批評美國試圖阻止中國正當崛起的行為是在挑起另一場「冷戰」。

The Chinese army is “unambiguous about safeguarding the sovereignty and territorial integrity of the country,” Song Zhongping, a commentator in Beijing who is a former Chinese military officer, said about the signal China is sending with this week’s military drills.

前中國軍官、北京評論員宋忠平表示，中國本週軍演所傳遞出的信息，就是中國軍隊「在維護國家主權和領土完整問題上是毫不含糊」。

Other analysts said China’s growing aggressiveness over Taiwan was backfiring by making more countries take notice. Some like the Philippines have even offered to bolster security cooperation with the United States by offering more access to its military bases.

其他專家則表示，中國對台灣愈發咄咄逼人的姿態引來了更多國家的警覺，導致了適得其反的效果。菲律賓等國甚至提出加強與美國的安全合作，開放更多軍事基地准入。

“The strengthening in China’s maritime combat power will further cause tensions near Taiwan,” said Su Tzu-yun from Taiwan’s Institute for National Defense and Security Research in Taipei. “But, at the same time, China also has to face more enemies in the region.”

「中國海上戰鬥力的增強將進一步加劇台灣地區的緊張局勢，」位於台北的台灣國防安全研究院專家蘇紫雲表示。「但與此同時，中國在該地區肯定也會樹敵更多。」

儲百亮(Chris Buckley)、Olivia Wang和Hikari Hida對本文有報導貢獻。

David Pierson報導中國外交政策和中國與世界的經濟與文化交互。點擊查看更多關於他的信息。

Amy Chang Chien在台北為時報報導中國大陸和台灣新聞。點擊查看更多關於她的信息。

item.title: 「中英」美參議院財政委員會通過法案，加深與台灣經濟聯繫
item.content:encoded:
The Senate Finance Committee on Thursday passed a bill that would deepen economic ties between the United States and Taiwan and effectively create a tax treaty that is expected to pave the way for more Taiwanese investment in the American semiconductor industry.

週四，參議院財政委員會通過一項法案，將加深美國與台灣之間的經濟聯繫，並在實際上創造一項稅收協定，預計將為台灣對美國半導體行業的更多投資鋪平道路。

The effort by Congress could inflame tensions between the United States and China at a time when the Biden administration has been working to stabilize the relationship. President Biden dispatched three cabinet officials to Beijing this summer to improve dialogue between the world’s two largest economies.

在拜登政府一直致力於穩定美中關係之際，國會的努力可能會加劇兩國之間的緊張關係。今年夏天，拜登總統派出三名內閣官員訪問北京，以改善世界上最大的兩個經濟體之間的對話。

In a rare demonstration of bipartisanship, the tax-writing committee passed the bill unanimously. Although Republicans and Democrats have vastly different views on most areas of tax policy, the two parties are united in their support for Taiwan and antipathy for China — which denies the island’s independence.

該稅法起草委員會一致通過了該法案，這是一次罕見的兩黨合作。儘管兩黨在稅收政策的大多數領域有著截然不同的觀點，但在支持台灣和反感（否認台灣獨立的）中國方面是一致的。

The legislation would end the double taxation between the United States and Taiwan that has strained business ties for years. Currently, Taiwanese companies and individuals doing business in the United States are taxed in both places, and vice versa for U.S. companies, making it expensive for the businesses to invest in one another.

這項立法將結束美國和台灣之間的雙重徵稅，這種徵稅多年來一直使商業關係緊張。目前，在美國做生意的台灣公司和個人在兩地都要納稅，美國公司也一樣，這使得兩國企業相互投資的成本很高。

The United States has tax treaties with many countries that eliminate double taxation, but it has been unable to form such a treaty with Taiwan because the two governments do not have official diplomatic ties. The United States established diplomatic ties with China in 1979 and broke off formal relations with Taiwan. Since then, every U.S. administration has tried to maintain an ambiguous position on Taiwan based on the “One China” policy.

美國與許多國家都有消除雙重徵稅的稅收協定，但由於美台之間沒有正式外交關係，美國一直無法與台灣達成這樣的協定。美國於1979年與中國建立外交關係，並斷絕了與台灣的正式關係。從那以後，每一屆美國政府都試圖在「一個中國」政策的基礎上對台灣保持模糊的立場。

Usually, U.S. administrations strike tax treaty agreements with other countries that are ratified by the Senate. To circumvent the normal tax treaty process, Congress has been working on legislation that would change the tax code directly as long as Taiwan enacts similar benefits for Americans who want to do business there.

通常情況下，美國政府與其他國家達成稅收協定，並由參議院批准。為了規避正常的稅收協定程序，美國國會一直在籌劃立法，只要台灣為希望在台灣做生意的美國人提供類似的優惠，就可以直接修改稅法。

The bill was drafted with input from House lawmakers and it could become law this year, if the full Senate and House approve it and President Biden signs it. The Biden administration has expressed support for ending double taxation with Taiwan.

該法案在起草過程中聽取了眾議院議員的意見，如果參眾兩院全體通過並由拜登總統簽署，可能在今年成為法律。拜登政府已表示支持結束對台灣的雙重徵稅。

Lawmakers view the legislation as a way to bolster American manufacturing and accelerate investment in the U.S. semiconductor industry. Congress approved more than $50 billion in support for the sector as part of the CHIPS Act legislation that was enacted last year and Taiwan, which is a global leader in the production of microchips, has been planning to build manufacturing facilities in the United States.

議員們認為，這項立法支持美國製造業和加速對美國半導體行業投資的一種方式。作為去年頒佈的《晶片法案》的一部分，國會批准了超過500億美元的資金支持該行業。在微晶片生產方面處於全球領先地位的台灣，一直計劃在美國建立製造工廠。

Senator Ron Wyden, Democrat of Oregon, who chairs the Senate Finance Committee, said on Thursday that the legislation would help make those plans possible.

參議院財政委員會主席、奧勒岡州民主党參議員榮恩·懷登週四表示，這項立法將有助於使這些計劃成為可能。

“To ensure that our country continues to grow these investments in America, relief of double taxation between the U.S. and Taiwan is an important next step,” Mr. Wyden said. “We do not want these investments to fall through or go to other countries because we are not providing double-tax relief.”

「為了確保我國繼續增加在美國的這些投資，減免美國和台灣之間的雙重徵稅是重要的下一步，」懷登說。「我們不希望這些投資因為我們不提供雙重稅收減免而落空，或是流向其他國家，。」

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company has been planning a new chip production facility in Arizona, but the project has been delayed amid concerns about labor shortages. The company said last year that the lack of a bilateral tax treaty had increased the cost of investing in the United States.

台積電一直計劃在亞利桑那州建立一個新的晶片生產工廠，但由於擔心勞動力短缺，該項目已被推遲。該公司去年表示，缺乏雙邊稅收協定增加了在美國投資的成本。

Closer business ties are only part of the appeal of the tax legislation for lawmakers.

更緊密的商業聯繫只是吸引議員們進行稅務立法的其中一個原因。

Mr. Wyden said it would also reinforce U.S. support for Taiwan at a moment when Beijing is showing increased aggression toward the island, which it considers part of China.

懷登說，在北京對台灣的侵略性日益加劇之際，這也將加強美國對台灣的支持。北京認為台灣是中國的一部分。

“Not only is Taiwan a critical trading partner; it is a democracy that shares our values and faces a growing threat,” he said.

「台灣不僅是一個重要的貿易夥伴，還是一個與我們有共同價值觀的民主政體，它正面臨日益嚴重的威脅，」他說。

Republicans on the Senate Finance Committee also voiced support for closer economic ties with Taiwan.

參議院財政委員會的共和黨人也表示支持與台灣建立更緊密的經濟聯繫。

Senator Chuck Grassley, Republican of Iowa, noted that Taiwan was a major importer of corn and soybeans from his state and said that the tax agreement would send a strong message to China.

愛奧瓦州共和黨參議員查克·格拉斯利指出，台灣是愛奧瓦州玉米和大豆的主要進口方，並表示這項稅收協議將向中國發出一個強烈的信號。

“I look forward to the expanded opportunities for economic cooperation with Taiwan that this bill affords Iowa businesses,” Mr. Grassley said. “More importantly, strengthening our ties with our democratic allies in Asia, as this bill does, is exactly the type of step this committee should take to counter the global ambitions of an increasingly hostile China.”

「我期待著這項法案為愛荷華州的企業提供與台灣擴大經濟合作的機會，」格拉斯利說。「更重要的是，加強我們與亞洲民主盟友的關係，正如這項法案所做的那樣，它正是本委員會為對抗日益敵對的中國的全球野心所應該採取的措施。」

China criticized the legislation on Thursday and suggested that it was a breach of the “One China principle.”

週四，中國批評了這項立法，並表示它違反了「一個中國原則」。

“China is always against any country negotiating economic and trade agreements of sovereign implication or official nature with China’s Taiwan region,” said Liu Pengyu, a spokesman for the Chinese embassy in Washington. “The U.S. must not negotiate agreements with sovereign implication or official nature with China’s Taiwan region or send any wrong signal to the ‘Taiwan independence’ separatist forces in the name of trade and economic interactions.”

「中國一貫反對任何國家與中國台灣地區談判具有具有主權意涵或官方性質的經貿協定，」中國駐華盛頓大使館發言人劉鵬宇表示。「美國不得與中國台灣地區談判具有主權意涵或官方性質的協議，不得以經貿往來的名義向『台獨』分裂勢力發出任何錯誤信號。」

The Senate Foreign Relations Committee passed a separate bill this summer to address double taxation with Taiwan, and a compromise may need to be reached between the committees. Lawmakers on Thursday expressed optimism that the legislation could be passed and sent to Mr. Biden in the coming months.

今年夏天，參議院外交關係委員會通過了一項單獨的法案，以解決與台灣的雙重徵稅問題，各委員會之間可能需要達成妥協。週四，議員們對該法案在未來幾個月內獲得通過並送交拜登表示樂觀。

“We very much share your goal to make sure that firms that are engaged between the U.S. and Taiwan are not subject to double taxation,” Jay Shambaugh, the Treasury under secretary for international affairs, told the Senate Foreign Relations Committee in July.

美國財政部負責國際事務的副部長傑·尚博格7月對參議院外交關係委員會表示：「我們非常贊同你們的目標，即確保在美國和台灣之間開展業務的公司不會受到雙重徵稅。」

He added, “It’s an incredibly important supply chain, it’s an incredibly important trading relationship, and its important that we don’t have double taxation issues.”

他還說，「這是一條非常重要的供應鏈，是一種非常重要的貿易關係，我們必須避免雙重徵稅問題。」

Alan Rappeport是時報駐華盛頓的經濟政策記者。 他負責報導財政部並撰寫有關稅收、貿易和財政事務的文章。 他此前曾在《金融時報》和《經濟學人》工作。點擊查看更多關於他的信息。

item.title: 「中英」中國否認限制公務員使用iPhone，但提及對安全問題擔憂
item.content:encoded:
China on Wednesday made its first public comments about reports that the government is restricting the use of Apple’s iPhones by some state employees, saying that Beijing had noted what it claimed were security concerns about the device.

中國在週三首次就有關政府限制部分國家僱員使用蘋果 iPhone的報導發表公開評論，稱政府注意到其所稱的有關蘋果手機安全問題的擔憂。

The comments by Mao Ning, a spokeswoman for the Foreign Ministry, were short on details. She pointed to what she described as “media reports” about security flaws in the iPhone, without elaborating.

該評論由外交部發言人毛寧發表，但缺乏細節。她提到，有「媒體曝出」所謂有關iPhone的安全問題，但沒有詳細說明。

She also said China had not published “any law, regulation or policy document” banning the purchase or use of foreign cellphones, including those made by Apple.

她還說，中國沒有發布禁止購買和使用外國品牌手機（包括蘋果手機）的「法律法規和政策文件」。

The comments come after some employees of government agencies have said they have had been told not to use iPhones for work. Notices issued to government employees and state-owned businesses, calling for usage of domestic brands of cellphones, have also been circulating online. China’s usually strict internet censors have yet to delete claims about the restrictions.

此前，一些政府公務員曾說，他們被要求在工作中不使用iPhone。要求公務員和國有企業員工使用國產品牌手機的通知也一直在網上流傳。中國通常都很嚴格的互聯網審查機構尚未刪除有關限制使用iPhone的說法。。

The company’s stock price initially fell following the reports, which had suggested that Apple could lose ground in China, the world’s largest smartphone market.

蘋果公司的股價在有關報導剛出來後出現下跌，這種限制意味著蘋果可能會在中國失勢，中國是全球最大的智慧型手機市場。

Calling for curbs on the use of foreign technology by government employees isn’t new. China has discouraged officials from adopting foreign cellphones for at least a decade and told government agencies to replace American computer servers and other devices with domestic ones.

限制政府僱員使用外國技術的要求並不新鮮。中國不鼓勵官員使用外國手機至少已有10年，政府機構也被要求用國產設備替代美國品牌的計算機伺服器和其他設備。

The United States has also placed restrictions on China’s telecommunications giant, Huawei, and issued controls on exports of advanced U.S. semiconductor technology to China. Some U.S. states have moved to restrict the use of TikTok, the social media app, by government employees.

美國政府也對使用中國電信設備巨頭華為的產品實施限制，並限制向中國出口美國的先進半導體技術。美國一些州已採取行動，限制政府工作人員使用社群媒體應用TikTok。

The White House national security spokesman, John F. Kirby, said on Wednesday that the U.S. government was “watching” the issue and called on China “to be more transparent about what they’re seeing and what they’re doing.”

白宮國家安全發言人約翰·柯比週三表示，美國政府正在「關注」這一問題，並呼籲中國」在他們所看到的和正在做的事情上更加透明」。

Any major problems for Apple in China would signal an escalation in the tensions between Beijing and Washington. The American technology giant counts on China for roughly 20 percent of its revenue and much of its manufacturing, which supports hundreds of thousands of local jobs.

蘋果公司在中國遇到的任何重大問題都將標誌著中美緊張關係的升級。這家美國技術巨頭有約20%的營收來自中國，靠中國製造其大部分產品，並為當地提供幾十萬個就業崗位。

Smartphones represent the latest salvo in the U.S.-China tech war after the launch last week of Huawei’s Mate 60 Pro. Chinese nationalists celebrated the cellphone’s advanced features as a sign that China had developed its own chips, but the device is now the target of a U.S. review into whether it violates the embargo on U.S. semiconductor technology imposed by the Biden administration.

中美技術爭奪戰的最新一輪表現在智慧型手機上，華為在上週推出了其新款手機Mate 60 Pro。中國民族主義者們對這款手機的先進功能大加讚賞，認為這意味著中國研發出了自己的晶片，但這款手機現已成為一項美國調查的對象，調查其是否違反了拜登政府有關向中國出口美國半導體技術的禁令。

Apple has not said anything publicly about the recent reports. At an event in California on Tuesday, the company unveiled the iPhone 15, its newest model.

蘋果尚未對最近的這些報導發表任何公開評論。該公司週二在加利福尼亞州的活動上推出了其最新款手機iPhone 15。

Olivia Wang和Zach Montague對本文有報導貢獻。

David Pierson報導中國外交政策和中國與世界的經濟與文化交互。點擊查看更多關於他的信息。

翻譯：紐約時報中文網

item.title: 「中英」歐盟宣布對中國電動車補貼展開調查
item.content:encoded:
The European Union will begin an investigation into Chinese subsidies of electric vehicles, the bloc’s top official announced Wednesday, in a move that highlights Europe’s growing industrial and geopolitical competition with China.

歐盟高級官員週三宣布將對中國電動汽車補貼展開調查，此舉凸顯了歐洲與中國日益激烈的工業和地緣政治競爭。

The inquiry could lead to trade restrictions, such as import tariffs on Chinese vehicles.

這項調查可能會導致貿易限制措施，比如對中國汽車徵收進口關稅。

Chinese automakers have gained a dominant position in the global electric vehicle industry and see Europe as a key potential market. Automakers in Europe, who are racing to expand their battery-powered lineups, have expressed concern that they face unfair competition against models from China that can be sold at a lower price, thanks to subsidies from the government in Beijing.

中國汽車製造商已在全球電動汽車行業佔據主導地位，並將歐洲視為一個重要的潛在市場。歐洲汽車製造商正在競相擴大自身電動汽車生產，它們對面臨來自中國的不公平競爭表示擔心，中國的電動汽車得到政府的補貼，所以售價較低。

“Europe is open for competition, not for a race to the bottom,” said Ursula von der Leyen, the president of the European Commission, speaking in Strasbourg, France. “We must defend ourselves against unfair practices.”

「歐洲對競爭敞開大門，但反對逐底競爭，」歐盟委員會主席烏蘇拉·馮德萊恩在法國斯特拉斯堡發表講話時說。「我們必須在不公平競爭面前保護自己。」

She announced the initiative during her annual state of the European Union address, which sets the tone for the year ahead.

她在發表為未來一年奠定基調的歐盟年度情況咨文演講時宣布了這項調查。

The European Union sees the electric vehicle sector as “a crucial industry for the clean economy, with huge potential for Europe,”Ms. von der Leyen said. “But global markets are now flooded with cheaper Chinese electric cars. And their price is kept artificially low by huge state subsidies.”

歐盟將電動汽車行業視為「清潔經濟的關鍵行業，對歐洲來說有巨大潛力」，馮德萊恩表示。「但現在全球市場上充斥著廉價的中國電動汽車，這些汽車的價格通過國家的巨額補貼被人為地壓低。」

Despite longstanding and deep economic ties between Europe and China, political and diplomatic relations between the two sides have deteriorated since Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022, because of Beijing’s support of Moscow.

儘管歐盟與中國有著長期、深厚的經濟聯繫，但自2022年2月俄羅斯入侵烏克蘭以來，由於北京支持莫斯科，歐盟與中國的政治和外交關係已在不斷惡化。

A flurry of diplomatic visits this year has underscored that European Union members don’t have a clear united policy on China. Ms. von der Leyen has been pushing for the concept of “de-risking” the Europe-China relationship by becoming less economically dependent on Beijing, rather than severing ties.

歐洲國家的領導人今年先後訪問了中國，凸顯了歐盟成員國沒有明確一致的對華政策。馮德萊恩一直在推動歐盟與中國關係「去風險」的概念，即減少經濟上對中國的依賴，但不切斷聯繫。

But the association representing German automakers urged caution in response to the inquiry. The industry is heavily invested in the Chinese auto market, the world’s largest, and a trade war with China over electric vehicles could cost them more than they stand to gain.

代表德國汽車製造商的協會在回應即將展開的調查時呼籲謹慎。德國汽車製造商已在全球最大的汽車市場中國投入了巨額資金，在電動汽車問題上與中國打貿易戰可能會讓它們得不償失。

Earlier this year, Volkswagen announced that it was investing 1 billion euros ($1.1 billion) to build a new innovation center for electric cars in Hefei, China. It also bought a $700 million stake in XPeng, a Chinese start-up that makes electric vehicles.

今年早些時候，大眾汽車曾宣布將投資10億歐元（約合77億元人民幣）在中國合肥建設一個新的電動汽車創新中心。大眾還購買了中國電動汽車初創企業小鵬汽車相當於七億美元（約合50億元）的股份。

“Possible counter reactions from China must be taken into account,” warned the German Association of the Automotive Industry.

「必須考慮中國可能做出的反擊，」德國汽車工業協會警告稱。

The inquiry would be part of a European Union push against what it calls anti-competitive behavior by China that throttles European businesses, costing Europe jobs and revenue.

這項調查將是歐盟反擊其所稱的中國反競爭行為的一部分，這些行為阻礙了歐洲企業的發展，給歐洲的就業和收入帶來損失。

“We have not forgotten how China’s unfair trade practices affected our solar industry,” Ms. von der Leyen said. “Many young businesses were pushed out by heavily subsidized Chinese competitors.”

「我們還沒有忘記中國的不公平貿易行為給我們的太陽能行業帶來了怎樣的影響，」馮德萊恩說。「得到大量補貼的中國競爭對手將歐洲的許多年輕企業擠出了市場。」

In the late 2000s, Beijing pumped vast amounts of money into solar energy technology, enabling domestic manufacturers to make multibillion-dollar investments in new factories and gain market share globally. China’s boom in production caused the price of panels to plummet, forcing dozens of companies in Europe and the United States out of business.

本世紀頭十年的後期，中國政府曾把大量資金投在太陽能技術上，讓國內的製造商們能夠投資上百億元建新工廠，在全球爭奪市場份額。中國製造的大量太陽能組件導致產品價格暴跌，迫使歐洲和美國的數十家公司破產。

China has taken a similar approach to the development and commercialization of electric cars. Government programs promoting production in China picked up speed after Wen Jiabao became the country’s premier in 2003. Mr. Wen set ambitious targets for the sale of electric cars and required cities to make sure that those targets were met.

中國在電動汽車的研發和商業化上也採取了類似的做法。溫家寶2003年擔任中國總理後，政府推進中國電動汽車生產的計劃加快了步伐。溫家寶為電動汽車銷售制定了雄心勃勃的目標，並要求各城市確保實現目標。

By 2009, China had set a clear goal of becoming a global leader in electric cars, and was offering government subsidies of $8,800 per car for taxi fleets and local government agencies in 13 Chinese cities to buy all-electric or hybrid gasoline-electric cars.

到2009年時，中國已制定了成為全球電動汽車行業領軍者的明確目標，並為中國13個城市的計程車隊和地方政府機關購買全電動或油電混合動力汽車提供了最高每輛八萬元的政府補貼。

Chinese makers of electric cars have been stepping up efforts to expand in Europe and elsewhere. China’s auto exports surged 31 percent in August, after a 63 percent jump in July, according to the China Passenger Car Association. New models from China dominated the international auto show held in Munich last week.

中國的電動汽車製造商一直加緊努力，在歐洲和世界其他地區擴張。據中國乘用車協會發布的數據，中國汽車出口在7月份猛增63%之後，8月份又增長31%。來自中國的新車型在上週的慕尼黑國際車展上佔據主導地位。

Keith Bradsher對本文有報導貢獻。

Matina Stevis-Gridneff是時報布魯塞爾分社社長，領導對歐盟的報導。她於2019年加入時報。點擊查看更多關於她的信息。

Melissa Eddy是一名駐柏林記者，報導德國政治、社會和文化議題。她於1996年作為富布萊特學者來到德國，此前在法蘭克福、維也納和巴爾幹半島在美聯社供職。點擊查看更多關於她的信息。
